title: Providing for the Closing of Executive Departments and Agencies of the Federal Government on January 9, 2025

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs all federal executive departments and agencies to close on January 9, 2025, to honor former President James Earl Carter, Jr., with exceptions allowed for critical operations related to national security and essential public needs. It also sets pay and leave treatment for employees affected by this closure and tasks the Office of Personnel Management with implementing the order.
potential_concerns: Certain federal employees required to work on the closure day may face scheduling and workload disruptions.
Some agencies might struggle with determining which functions qualify as essential, leading to uneven implementation.
The closure could temporarily delay public services, impacting government service users.
There may be increased administrative burden on the Office of Personnel Management and agency leadership to manage pay, leave, and operational continuity.
Potential conflicts could arise if funding or appropriations are insufficient to support the orderâ€™s implementation.
